subtitle: Childhood
content: I started programming in 2007, at age 14. Two years later, I wrote my first interpreter for a programming language of my creation and I had written a dozen lessons for the website OpenClassrooms. I spent most of my free time focusing on what had become a vocation.

subtitle: Studies & Job
content: Soon after, I moved towards computer science studies and ended my learning path with a professional degree called designer / developer for decentralized architecture. I then worked as a software engineer for a research laboratory, which has become a regular customer now that I'm self-employed.
